resources.string:
Mental health concerns are a common issue in patients living with Inflammatory Bowel Disease. Based on your responses, the program has calculated your levels of anxiety, depression and stress.

Please be aware that these results are only subjective. A comprehensive assessment by a trained mental health specialist is needed to confirm any diagnosis or symptom severity.

If you have any concerns or questions, please talk to your IBD nurse, gastroenterologist, medical practitioner or mental health professional (e.g., psychiatrist, psychologist).
Do you have an appointment with a mental health expert within the next 14 days or willing to contact your local doctor (GP) if your mental health symptoms worsen?
Are you currently seeing a mental health professional?
Do you consider hurting yourself, others, or feel suicidal?
Please return this tablet to reception
Thank you for your responses and feedback
Touch here to go\nback to start screen
Based on these scores the following advice was provided:
Thank you for completing the brief health assessment

Mental health concerns are a common issue in patients living with Inflammatory Bowel Disease. Based on your responses, the program has calculated your levels of anxiety, depression and stress.

Please be aware that these results are only subjective. A comprehensive assessment by a trained mental health specialist is needed to confirm any diagnosis or symptom severity.

If you have any concerns or questions, please talk to your IBD nurse, gastroenterologist, medical practitioner or mental health professional (e.g., psychiatrist, psychologist).
Individuals tend to report minimal levels of psychological distress
Individuals tend to report some symptoms which may be associated with psychological distress
Individuals tend to report symptoms, which more often than not, may be associated with psychological distress
Individuals tend to report strong and frequent symptoms which may be associated with psychological distress
For further information and strategies to manage psychological distress related to IBD please go to IBDclinic.org.au

We recommend you meet with your mental health professional or doctor if symptoms worsen. For further information and strategies to manage psychological distress related to IBD please go to IBDclinic.org.au

We recommend you contact your mental health professional or doctor within 24 hours and arrange a mental health review. Please also feel free to contact your local hospital IBD nurse or Lifeline.org.au
We recommend you contact your mental health professional or doctor immediately to arrange a mental health review. Please also feel free to contact your local hospital IBD nurse or Lifeline.org.au
Are you considering harming yourself or thinking about suicide?\nPlease talk about these thoughts/feelings with your Gastroenterologist/IBD nurse
If you have any questions or concerns please talk to your Gastroenterologist or IBD nurse
Please review these results with your Gastroenterologist or IBD nurse
In relation to your PSYCHOLOGICAL health, you were identified to have the following results :
In the past 3 months your IBD has been:
Overall level of self-confidence when it comes to managing your own PHYSICAL health?
PAIN LEVELS on average over the last 24 hours?
FATIGUE LEVELS on average over the last 24 hours?
In relation to your PHYSICAL health, you were identified to have the following results:
Outpatient Brief Health Assessment Review Summary of Results
Please write down on the slip of paper provided the following results to discuss with your Gastroenterologist/IBD nurse:

Mental health concerns are a common issue in patients living with Inflammatory Bowel Disease. This program will ask you about your mental health symptoms and provide feedback about various options that may be of benefit.

Total time to complete this assessment will be 10 minutes.

If you have any concerns, please talk to your IBD nurse or Gastroenterologist.

We are looking to develop an online support tool that patients can use on a fortnightly basis to report and manage their IBD symptoms, medications, mental health and quality of life.
 
This online service would NOT replace your current visits to the outpatient IBD clinic, but allow us to work with you more effectively to manage your IBD.
 
This online service would also allow you to communicate with your health professionals.
 
The following questions ask about your interest in using the online service.
4. Number of years diagnosed with IBD?
5. In the past 3 months my IBD has been ?
6. How would you rate your quality of life ?
7. How would you rate your level of social support ?
8. Please Rate your overall level of self-confidence when it comes to managing your own PHYSICAL health ?
9. Please Rate your overall level of self-confidence when it comes to managing your own MENTAL health ?
10. How would you rate your quality of sleep ?
11. Average number of hours sleep in the last 24 hours ?
12. I found it hard to wind down
13. I tended to over-react to situations
14. I felt that I was using a lot of nervous energy
16. I found it difficult to relax
17. I was intolerant of anything that kept me from getting on with what I was doing
18. I felt that I was rather touchy
19. I was aware of dryness of my mouth
20. I experienced breathing difficulty (e.g., excessively rapid breathing, breathlessness in the absence of physical exertion)
21. I experienced trembling (e.g., in the hands)
22. I was worried about situations in which I might panic and make a fool of myself
23. I felt I was close to panic
24. I was aware of the action of my heart in the absence of physical exertion (e.g., sense of heart rate increase, heart missing a beat)
25. I felt scared without any good reason
26. I couldn\'t seem to experience any positive feeling at all
27. I found it difficult to work up the initiative to do things
28. I felt that I had nothing to look forward to
30. I was unable to become enthusiastic about anything
31. I felt I wasn\'t worth much as a person
32. I felt that life was meaningless
33. Do you consider hurting yourself, others, or feel suicidal?
34. Are you currently are CURRENTLY seeing a mental health professional?
35. Do you have an appointment with a mental health expert within the next 14 days or are willing to contact your local doctor (GP) if your mental health symptoms worsen?
36. Please select the option that best describes your PAIN LEVELS on average over the last 24 hours?
37. Please select the option that best describes your FATIGUE LEVELS on average over the last 24 hours?
2. How likely are you to follow-up on the advice that was provided?
3. Did you experience any distress after receiving feedback about your results?
4. Are the results provided consistent with your sense of current mental health status?
5. How helpful would an online out-patient service be to help monitor your IBD activity?
6. How willing would you be to use an online out-patient service to help monitor your IBD activity?
7. How helpful would an online out-patient service be to help monitor your IBD-associated medications?
8. How willing would you be to use an online out-patient service to help monitor your IBD-associated medications?
9. How helpful would an online out-patient service be to help monitor your mental health?
10. How willing would you be to use an online out-patient service to help monitor your mental health?
11. How helpful would an online out-patient service be to communicate with your Gastroenterologist/IBD nurse?
12. How willing would you be to use an online out-patient service to help communicate with your Gastroenterologist/IBD nurse?
13. What type of IBD outpatient service would you prefer:
14. How much trust do you place on your face-to-face visits with your Gastroenterologist/IBD nurse?
15. How much trust do you think you would place on an online IBD outpatient service?
16. How easy was it to use this tablet-based program?
17. How willing would be to use this tablet-based program when you attend the outpatient clinic to help monitor your physical and psychological well-being?
Please write down on the slip of paper provided the following results to discuss with your Gastroenterologist/IBD nurse:
Currently seeing a mental health expert?

string-array.name: condition
string-array.item: Crohn’s disease with Irritable Bowel Syndrome
Ulcerative colitis with Irritable Bowel Syndrome

string-array.name: past_3_month_ibd
string-array.item: Constantly active, giving me symptoms every day
Often active, giving me symptoms most days
Sometimes active, giving me symptoms on some days (for instance 1 – 2 days / week)
Occasionally active, giving me symptoms 1 – 2 days / month
Rarely active, giving me symptoms on a few days in the past 3 months
I was well in the past 3 months, what I consider a remission or absence of symptoms

string-array.name: array_12_to_32
string-array.item: Did not apply to me at all
Applied to me to some degree, or some of the time
Applied to me to a considerable degree, or a good part of time
Applied to me very much, or most of the time
